ROME, Nov. 19 (Xinhua) -- The United States-based Amazon announced Friday that it invested a total of 2.9 billion euros (3.3 billion U.S. dollars) in Italy last year, an increase of more than 60 percent compared to the previous year.

As of Friday, Amazon's Italian subsidiary employed 12,500 full-time workers, an increase of 3,000 over the last year. The company said it expects to hire another 500 workers before the end of this year.

The company said it earned 7.25 billion euros in revenue last year, compared to 4.5 billion euros in revenue in 2019. That is an increase of 61 percent.

Amazon has invested a total of 8.7 billion euros in Italy since it began on-site operations in the country in 2010, according to a statement.

In the statement, the company cited a study by the consultancy European House - Ambrosetti which showed that Amazon had created more jobs than any other companies in Italy over the last decade.

According to Italian media reports, Amazon's Italian subsidiary has been among the largest beneficiaries of the economic trend that saw more people using online shopping due to health restrictions related to the coronavirus pandemic. (1 euro=1.13 U.S. dollars) Enditem
